Detailed Description

An encapulation of a data buffer.

Provides methods to read and write single bytes, short integers (16bits) and integers (32bits). Uses methods to be independent of big or little endian architecture.

const char *  name,
bool  quiet = false
) 
 

Create a DataBuffer with specified size and name.

Parameters:
bufSize The size of the buffer in bytes.
name Name that can be printed when writing outside the buffer. (For debug, will not be copied).
quiet If set, does not report warnings about allocating 0 bytes.

uint32  bufSize
) 
 

Create a DataBuffer from a already allocated memory area.

Parameters:
buffer Pointer to a 32bit aligned memory area.
bufSize Buffer size in bytes.

DataBuffer::DataBuffer (  const DataBuffer &  other,
bool  shrinkToOffset = false
) 
 

Copy constructor.

The name will not be copied since we don't know where that came from. Even if the other buffer is mmapped then the new one will not be mmapped.

Parameters:
other The data buffer to copy the buffer from.
shrinkToOffset True if the new buffer should be shrinked to the offset of the other one.

DataBuffer::DataBuffer (  const SharedBuffer &  other,
bool  shrinkToOffset = false
) 
 

Copy constructor.

Parameters:

shrinkToOffset True if the new buffer should be shrinked to the offset of the other one.

bool DataBuffer::memMapFile (  const char *  file,
bool  readWrite = false,
bool  exitIfFails = true
) 
 

Memory map a file for access via the DataBuffer.

Note that this is not compatible with restoreFromStream/saveToStream!

Parameters:
file Path to the file
readWrite if true changes to the DataBuffer will be saved to the file when the DataBuffer is destroyed
exitIfFails If true exit will be called if the mmap fails. Should be removed when it is examined where it is used.

void DataBuffer::outsideBufferErrorPrint (  const char *  methodName  )  const [protected]
 

Prints outside buffer error messages.

Implemented in the cpp-file because it should be possible to place a break point in it in gdb.

Parameters:
methodName The name of the method causing the outside buffer error.

void DataBuffer::setName (  const char *  name  )  [inline]
 

Sets the debug name for the DataBuffer.

Will not be copied so it should be a pointer to a static one. Will be printed if something goes wrong.
